definition: to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

sentences.english: Penalizing people for selecting wrong answers does not eliminate the guessing problem.
sentences.chinese: 因爲選錯答案而懲罰應試者並沒有減少猜答案的問題。

sentences.english: WCCC can free the students from the puzzle of examination-education and can also make the students get ideal results in exams.
sentences.chinese: 擺脫應試教育的困擾，而又能在考試中考出理想成績。

sentences.english: ” “An interviewee took his bubble gum out of his mouth and held it in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 一個應試者把泡泡糖從嘴裏拿出來攥在手裏。

sentences.english: Imperial selection started at the beginning of Sui Dynasty, so the tendency of examinations began to spread.
sentences.chinese: 在隋朝開始的科舉選才，應試之風開始蔓延。

sentences.english: The fourth chapter makes an evaluation of examination-oriented poems and poetic prose in the Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 第四章對唐代應試詩賦進行了一個整體的評價。

sentences.english: Most of our nation’s leading testing experts think this is a risky path.
sentences.chinese: 我們國家多數領頭應試專家認爲這是危險的路徑。

sentences.english: So, our country decide to change exam-oriented education to quality education.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我國決定把應試教育轉向素質教育。

sentences.english: Examination-oriented education has great influence because it has formed a system.
sentences.chinese: 應試教育因其體制化而產生巨大影響。

sentences.english: In our country's basic education, the problem is clear that the competence of passing the examinations has been emphasized.
sentences.chinese: 我國基礎教育對應試的過分強調使教育的弊端漸現。

sentences.english: It will reform the exam-oriented educational mode, and widely practice quality-oriented education.
sentences.chinese: 改革應試教育模式，全面實施素質教育。

sentences.english: Our teacher of physics suggested that we(should)try to make some electronic toys ourselves .
sentences.chinese: 我們的物理老師建議我們自己應試着做一些電動玩具。

sentences.english: That's because the examination system does not allow independent thinking, " he told local media.
sentences.chinese: 原因就在於應試教育不允許學生獨立思考。

sentences.english: Let’s look at penalizing people for guessing an answer incorrectly for example.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們來看看懲罰猜錯答案的應試者這個例子。

sentences.english: The candidate will take an oral examination.
sentences.chinese: 那個應試者將參加口試。

sentences.english: A relaxed job candidate is a confident job candidate.
sentences.chinese: 心態放鬆的應試者是自信的。

sentences.english: Chin's current educational system is still exam-oriented education.
sentences.chinese: 中國目前的教育制度依然是應試教育。

definition: to attend (a school)/to drop out (of college etc)
to comment/a point by point commentary
pausing at the end of a phrase or sentence (in former times, before punctuation marks were used)/punctuation/periods and commas/sentences and phrases
pragmatic/flexible/to act differently in different situations/to accommodate to circumstances
to practice medicine (esp. in private practice)
to transcribe/to make a fair copy
